segments.text: Hi , my name is Ted , what ’ s yours ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I said , I ’ m Ted , who are you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Huh ? Oh , my name is Laura .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Huh ? I can ’ t hear you , the music ’ s too loud .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Let ’ s go outside and talk . So Laura , do you come here often ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Hold on , my ears are still ringing from the music ... what was it you asked me ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I asked if you come here often .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sometimes , usually once every few weeks . Do you ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , this is my first time here .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I usually come with a group of friends . We dance a little , have a few drinks , and just have a good time .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yeah , that ’ s why I ’ m here . My friends dragged me here , because they think I spend too much time studying .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ’ s good . It ’ s good to hit the books , but you need to get out once in a while .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I guess so . But the music is too loud . I don ’ t mind getting out and meeting people , but next time I ’ ll do it in a park .
segments.speaker: S1
